channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: WGAイーストがG/Oメディアを不当労働行為で告訴、G/Oメディアは進行中の交渉で「不誠実な交渉」をしていると主張（Katie Kilkenny/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Katie Kilkenny / The Hollywood Reporter:
The WGA East files an unfair labor practice charge against G/O Media, alleging that G/O Media has been “bargaining in bad faith” in ongoing negotiations  —  The union represents creative staffers at The Onion, The A.V. Club and Deadspin who have threatened to strike if a new deal isn't reached by Jan. 31.

item.title: 全米映画監督組合は、WGAが獲得したのと同じストリーミングの残留報酬とストリーミング・プラットフォームの視聴データへのアクセスを確保したと発表（Katie Kilkenny/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Katie Kilkenny / The Hollywood Reporter:
The Directors Guild of America says it has secured the same streaming residuals and access to streaming platform viewing data that the WGA won  —  The union informed members on Thursday that it had also improved employer contribution rates to its pension and health plans in the second and third years of its contract.

item.title: フォーブスのマイク・フェデルCEOがレイオフを発表、従業員の3％弱に影響、フォーブスは「現在の経済環境では警戒を怠らない必要がある」と述べた（Sara Fischer/@sarafischer）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / @sarafischer:
Forbes CEO Mike Federle announces layoffs affecting less than 3% of staff, saying Forbes “must remain vigilant in our current economic environment”  —  NEW: @forbes layoffs announced today, the same day its union announced a 3-day walkout. — Unclear how many impacted yet — CEO Mike Federer said in a note to staff that Forbes “must remain vigilant in our current economic environment.”

item.title: パラマウントCEOはメモの中で、「ストリーミングの収益性を高める」「最大の影響力を持つコンテンツを最大化する」など、2024年に向けた成長戦略を概説している（Georg Szalai/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Georg Szalai / The Hollywood Reporter:
In a memo, Paramount CEO outlines growth strategies for 2024, including “driving to streaming profitability” and “maximizing content with the biggest impact”  —  As speculation kicks up about a sale, Bob Bakish wrote a memo outlining strategies such as …

item.title: パラマウントのボブ・バキッシュCEOはメモの中で、「よりスリムな会社として運営し、経費を削減する」必要があるとして、レイオフを発表した。
item.description:
Sara Salinas / CNBC:
In a memo, Paramount CEO Bob Bakish announces layoffs, citing a need to “operate as a leaner company and spend less”; he did not disclose the size of the cuts  —  - Paramount CEO Bob Bakish announced layoffs at the media company.  — He did not disclose how many jobs the company would cut.

item.title: 中国で初めて開催された2023年のヒューゴー賞から、対象となるSF作品のいくつかが除外されていたことが文書で明らかになり、検閲の懸念が高まった（Amy Hawkins/The Guardian）
item.description:
Amy Hawkins / The Guardian:
Documents reveal that several eligible sci-fi works were excluded from the 2023 Hugo Awards, held for the first time in China, raising censorship concerns  —  Concerns raised about interference or censorship after documents showed writers were barred despite receiving enough nominations

item.title: ビンス・マクマホンからギャラを受け取り、2022年にNDAにサインした元WWEスタッフのジャネル・グラントが、WWEとマクマホンの性売買を告発する訴訟を起こす（Khadeeja Safdar/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Khadeeja Safdar / Wall Street Journal:
Janel Grant, an ex-WWE staffer who received a payout from Vince McMahon and signed an NDA in 2022, files a lawsuit accusing WWE and McMahon of sex trafficking  —  Janel Grant files lawsuit saying McMahon pressured her into sex with him and other men at WWE, raising questions about 2022 board probe into CEO's payouts

item.title: ロサンゼルス・タイムズ紙がテリー・タンを臨時編集長に任命、タンは2022年2月からLAタイムズ紙の編集長を務めていた（Meg James/Los Angeles Times）
item.description:
Meg James / Los Angeles Times:
The Los Angeles Times appoints Terry Tang as the paper's interim executive editor; Tang has been LA Times's editorial page editor since February 2022  —  Los Angeles Times owner Dr. Patrick Soon-Shiong has appointed Terry Tang, editor of the editorial page, as the paper's executive editor on an interim basis.

item.title: 情報筋リライアンスとの合併交渉において、ディズニーのインド資産の評価額は～45億ドルで、ディズニーが当初目指していた100億ドルを下回る（Bloomberg）。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Sources: Disney's India assets are being valued at ~$4.5B in merger negotiations with Reliance, less than the $10B Disney initially pursued  —  - Unit valued at about $4.5 billion from $10 billion previously  — Losses incurred from cricket rights weigh on its valuation

item.title: 情報筋BuzzFeedはフードサイトのTastyとFirst We Feastの売却を検討中。Viceを買収したFortress Investment GroupはRefinery29の売却交渉中。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources: BuzzFeed is looking to sell its food sites, Tasty and First We Feast; Fortress Investment Group, which took over Vice, is in talks to sell Refinery29  —  Latest sale discussions signal further struggles of once-hot digital media companies  —  BuzzFeed and Vice Media …

item.title: Fubo TV、AIを使ってFox News、MSNBC、CNNなどの生放送ニュース番組の見出しを生成する「Instant Headlines Beta」を開始（Luke Bouma/Cord Cutters News）
item.description:
Luke Bouma / Cord Cutters News:
Fubo TV launches Instant Headlines Beta, which uses AI to generate headlines from live news programs on Fox News, MSNBC, CNN, and other networks  —  You may be familiar with AI-powered highlights of sporting events.  Now, though, Fubo has announced for the first time you will be able to get instant headlines from live news programs.

item.title: 米連邦控訴裁判所は9対7で、テキサス州在住の市民ジャーナリスト、プリシラ・ヴィラレアルが警察関係者に質問したことで逮捕されたことについて、当局を訴えることはできないとの判決を下した（ネイト・レイモンド／ロイター）。
item.description:
Nate Raymond / Reuters:
A US appeals court rules 9-7 that Texas-based citizen journalist Priscilla Villarreal cannot sue officials over her arrest for asking a police source questions  —  A citizen journalist in Texas cannot sue officials over her arrest for asking a police source questions, a divided federal appeals court …

item.title: CUNYのクレイグ・ニューマーク・スクール・オブ・ジャーナリズムは、2025年に学生の50％の授業料を負担し、2026年までに授業料無償化を全学生に拡大するための資金調達を計画している（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
CUNY's Craig Newmark School of Journalism plans to cover tuition for 50% of students in 2025 and raise money to expand free tuition to all students by 2026  —  The Craig Newmark Graduate School of Journalism at CUNY is going tuition-free, its namesake Craig Newmark and the school's dean, Graciela Mochkofsky, told Axios.

item.title: Business Insiderのバーバラ・ペンCEOは、ビジネス、テック、イノベーションの取材に集中する計画の一環として、同誌がスタッフの8％をレイオフすると発表した（Barbara Peng/Business Insider）。
item.description:
Barbara Peng / Business Insider:
Business Insider CEO Barbara Peng says the outlet is laying off 8% of its staff, as part of its plan to focus on covering business, tech, and innovation  —  At the end of 2023, we announced our way ahead: We're Business Insider, our center of gravity is business, tech, and innovation …

item.title: NYデイリーニューズ紙記者、レイオフと新残業規定に抗議し1日の業務停止を開始、2022年以降組合員の3分の1が脱退、54人が残る（ケイティ・ロバートソン／ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
Katie Robertson / New York Times:
NY Daily News journalists begin a one-day work stoppage to protest layoffs and a new overtime policy; a third of union members have left since 2022, leaving 54  —  Newsroom workers at The Daily News Union, which formed in 2021, are in negotiations for their first contract.
